result.execSummary:
The defendant David A. Vargas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Repeater, Second and Subsequent Offense, Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Youth Center], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: *Eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program after serving 18 months of sentence.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay fine plus costs
*Pay Drug Abuse Surcharge
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.
*Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.

*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
*Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
*Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

*Obtain all prescriptions from one pharmacy.
*Participate in any counseling or assessments as deemed appropriate and recommended by the agent.
*Pay the balance of the GPS home detention fee's while on probation.
*Provide a DNA sample, if not already done so
*AODA & comply with treatment recommendations, if not completed within the last year.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Youth Center

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David A. Vargas in court with attorney Eric Sheets. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:07 a.m.  Atty Knaapen calls case and states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - No contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Sheets makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay 5 year prison sentence
3 years of initial confinement
Eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program, after 18 months of incarceration
2 years extended supervision
**Placed on Probation for 24 months -
Conditions of Probation:
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations, if not completed within the last year
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
All prescriptions from one pharmacy.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.
Participate in any counseling or assessments as deemed appropriate and as recommended by the agent.
Pay $500 fine plus costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay Drug Abuse Surcharge
Pay balance of GPS home detention fee's
Provide a DNA Sample, if not already done so
**Bond monies shall be used for the fine/costs
86 days of jail 
86 days pre-trial incarceration credit

20 days to appeal
Disbursements Journal Final
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 15, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Defendant Record Update

Amended from a $1,000 cash bond and $9,000 signature bond as of 11/07/16.
$1,000 cash bond to be applied to the HDP fee's.
Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  *7 times per week.  
Defendant to be taken off of the ankle monitor.
All other non-monetary conditions remain the same.

Defendant David A. Vargas in court with attorney Eric Sheets. David Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:52 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

BTC:  Court grants request.

Atty Sheet request bond modification to remove pretrial supervision program conditions. BTC: Court denies the motion to amend bond.

By The Court: Motion to Suppress is Denied  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 7, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Motion hearing on September 27, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant David A. Vargas in court with attorney Eric Sheets. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:20 PM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Matter is set for a motion hearing at this time.
Parties are prepared to proceed.

State has one witness to call.

3:20 PM Michael Retzki is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Knaapen.
3:24 PM Cross-examination by Atty Sheets.
3:37 PM Re-direct by Atty Knaapen.
3:42 PM Re-cross by Atty Sheets.

3:47 PM State has no further witnesses.

Atty Sheets is not calling any witnesses.

Atty Knaapen wishes to argue the matter.
Atty Sheets wishes to argue the matter as well.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, gives argument for the record, states the Defense motion should be denied.
Atty Sheets addresses the Court, gives argument for the record, requests the Court to grant the Defense's motion.
Atty Knaapen replies.
Atty Sheets replies.

Court addresses the parties, states the facts for the record.

Court finds the stop was legally permissable. Officer then detected an odor.

Court wants a brief memo from each party as to the search of the vehicle, to be submitted by  September 23rd.

Court will then make a decision. 

BY THE COURT:
Bond and conditions of bond are ordered continued.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 27, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

BY THE COURT:

Status conference on June 6, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant David A. Vargas in court with attorney Eric Sheets. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

2:02 PM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

This is on today, on a notice of motion and motion and a motion to suppress.

Both parties are ready to proceed.

2:03 PM John Moss is called and sworn in, officer with SPPD.
Direct examination by Atty Knaapen.
Witness identifies Defendant.
2:09 PM Cross-examination by Atty Sheets.
2:11 PM Court addresses the parties, does not know what the basis of the stop is.
Atty Knaapen addresses the Court.
2:12 PM Cross-examination by Atty Sheets continues.
2:15 PM Court re-evaluates Atty Knaapen's objection.
Witness is acting upon what his supervisor told him.
Court is not sure how the witness can answer anymore questions.
Atty Sheets addresses the Court.
2:16 PM Cross-examination continues again.
2:23 PM Examination by the Court.
2:25 PM Cross-examination continues again.
2:29 PM Examination by the Court.
2:30 PM Cross-examination continues again.
(police narrative report is referred to, to refresh recollection)
2:35 PM Re-direct by Atty Knaapen.
2:39 PM Re-cross by Atty Sheets.
2:44 PM Re-direct by Atty Knaapen.
2:44 PM Re-cross by Atty Sheets.

2:45 PM State will not call any further witnesses.
Defense will not be calling any witnesses.

Court does not believe this is a complete record but will listen to closing arguments.

2:45 PM Atty Sheets addresses the Court.
2:49 PM Atty Knaapen addresses the Court.
2:58 PM Atty Sheets replies.

Court addresses the parties.

BY THE COURT:
Court grants the Defense motion and suppress the evidence in this case.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court regarding supplementing the record with the Supervisor, Sgt Retzki.
Court will take that under consideration.

Court wants this case to stay on track.

Atty Sheets addresses bond, regarding what happened today.
Court believes the bond modification is pre-mature.
Court will consider it, if it is brought properly before the Court. Court would at least want a report from the pretrial supervisor. 

  Status conference scheduled for June 6, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Motion hearing on May 10, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant David A. Vargas in court with attorney Eric Sheets. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:11 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Matter is set for a motion hearing today.
Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, is not prepared to proceed. Officer Moss was subpoenad but realized that this officer is out of state on vacation. Officer did notify the DA's office earlier. Atty Knaapen apologizes, is not the Officer's fault.  

Atty Sheets addresses the Court, was made aware of this.

Court addresses another issue regarding motion itself.  Motion was filed March 25th, which was on Friday. It was January 25th pretrials that counsel filled out a pretrial report, for today's hearing. Court does perfer that if something is scheduled like this, is to be filed simutaneously, the hearing and the motion.  Court reminds counsel that if any motion is filed, a copy is to be filed with the Court as well. 

Court will reschedule this. 

Atty Sheets addresses the Court, apologizes for not filing motion more timely and did drop off a courtesy copy. 
Court requests that any motions are to be stamped copy. 

BY THE COURT:
Bond and conditions of bond are ordered continued.

9:22 AM Court is in recess.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 10, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

ADA  Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

1:15 PM Court calls case.

ADA  Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of Possession with Intent to Deliver.

Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a cash bond $25,000  with conditions as stated.

Defendant addresses the Court, requests lower cash bond or signature bond for reasons stated on the record.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, replies.

Court's decision stands, will remain at $10,000.

Defendant requests another Judge, conflict of interest, as to regarding bond that has been ordered.

BY THE COURT:
Court states decision can be reviewed, decision stands.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for: October 12, 2015 @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2
